name: Albert Einstein

structured_info.background: Einstein published four groundbreaking physics papers at age 39, and is renowned for developing the special theory of relativity and the equation E=mcÂ². His estimated IQ ranges from 160-205. Though widely regarded as an anti-racist and human rights advocate, recently translated diaries reveal he held racist views regarding people from China, Japan, Sri Lanka, and India.

summary: Albert Einstein was a highly influential physicist of the modern era, best known for his theories of relativity. Despite his public stance on human rights, newly discovered diary entries reveal complex and problematic racist viewpoints.
